intro: Jussiaea myrtifolia f. pohliana, commonly known as the Pohliana form of the Myrtle-leaved Jussiaea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in wetlands and along the edges of streams, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of these habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant for botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
